synopsis.text:
Kimura's "Deathtic 4" explores a zombie-filled world where a living frog falls from the sky, and a young zombie boy and his friends embark on a mission to return it to its own world. In Fukuyama's "Doorbell," a man must outrun alternate versions of himself to maintain control over his life. Futamura's "Limit Cycle" delves into the life of a man trapped in a never-ending cycle of work, while Yuasa's "Happy Machine" follows an infant who discovers the world outside his fake nursery, filled with alien-like creatures. Finally, Watanabe's "Baby Blue" tells the story of two young students who embark on a one-day adventure, cherishing their time together.

Genius Party is a collection of seven unique and captivating animated short films from Studio 4Â°C. Each story offers a distinct perspective, ranging from heartwarming to bizarre. The anthology features a diverse range of characters, including a hunter and his prey in a surreal Serengeti, a boy who brings his drawings to life with a futuristic device, and two delinquent schoolchildren on a nostalgic train ride. With its high standard of quality and inspiration, Genius Party takes viewers on a journey through the minds of Japan's most prolific artists.
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
